intro: Aethionema transhyrcanum, commonly known as the Transcaspian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial plant that typically thrives in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water. Aethionema transhyrcanum is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics.
